ygData.subject: Re: [EQ_women] Just wanted to say Hello
ygData.msgSnippet: Hello, Rita! I, too, no longer play Everquest, but I still enjoy the fellowship I have found on this list so I continue to lurk. ;-)  I love your character
ygData.messageBody:
Hello, Rita!

I, too, no longer play Everquest, but I still enjoy the fellowship I have
found on this list so I continue to lurk. ;-) I love your character names!
I am guessing your druid is a Halfling?

Suzanne Johnson
player of Aelwesara C├╗thalion, formerly a Ranger of Tunare, now a Druid of
Corellon Larethian (Dungeons and Dragons 3rd Edition)


----- Original Message -----
From: "Judy Tyrer" <judy3t@...>
To: <EQ_women@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Saturday, March 10, 2001 7:29 PM
Subject: Re: [EQ_women] Just wanted to say Hello


Greetings! I dont' play anymore but I confess I do miss it terribly.
Still, I can't handle the addiction.

Iceiallana
Druid of the 54th circle
Brell Serilis

----- Original Message -----
From: Coco Avignon
To: EQ_women@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Saturday, March 10, 2001 9:33 AM
Subject: [EQ_women] Just wanted to say Hello


Hi !
I subscribe today to this mailing list and wanted to say "Hello" to all
others.
I am playing Everquest since November 1999 and really love it. My husband
is playing to on a seperate PC.
My favorite character is a druid, named "Bandyleg Whompyknobber" and my
alt char is a Monk with the name "Yuanshih". Both on the Solusek Ro server.
In RL i come from Austria in Europe, so you have to look over the Z and Y
i am changing. Cause the game doesnt support a german keyboard, and now i am
so used to switching thos two letters, that i have problems in E-Mails :-))
Greetings
Rita

Yahoo! Groups Sponsor
